metadata.title: CVE-2014-9651 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in CHICKEN 4.9.0.x before 4.9.0.2, 4.9.x before 4.9.1, andbefore 5.0 allows attackers to have unspecified impact via a positive STARTargument to the "substring-index[-ci] procedures."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9651` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chicken-bin - 4.10.0-1
libchicken8 - 4.10.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chicken package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1').
